data.text: Mersch: We provided banks with favourable conditions through different instruments. We gave them capital space too. This is not meant for shareholders, but for the economy, and should be used to increase provisioning to avoid cliff effects when moratoria and guarantees end 3/4

(THREAD) Uncertainty remains in the current environment, Executive Board member Yves Mersch tells Bloomberg @business. We have our programmes, they have been extremely efficient and we believe they need to continue https://t.co/PJNtmlQMoI 1/4 https://t.co/WYcHC3nKpo

The ECB seeks comments from the banking industry and other stakeholders on a draft guide on how the ECB expects banks to manage and disclose climate-related and environmental risks. Send your comments by 25 September. Read more https://t.co/HxLAUhsqOz https://t.co/VFoSGKYavX

Panetta: Macroeconomic policies, above all monetary and fiscal policies, must remain complementary, and the support they provide may be needed for a long time. All macroeconomic policies need to consider the horizon of their measures. Read the speech https://t.co/wn4tf1nm9O  3/3

Panetta: The economic outlook is clouded by an unprecedented degree of uncertainty, not least because it depends on uncertain public health developments. This is not a normal recession, and we will not see a normal recovery without appropriate policies 2/3

(THREAD) The macroeconomic situation remains fragile and uncertain, and the projected inflation path is still clearly short of our aim. Faced with sizeable downside risks, there is a strong case for our reaction function to be asymmetric 1/3 https://t.co/c5oeeW1d3n

Why is collateral important? If banks want to borrow money from central banks, they need to post collateral as a guarantee. This way, central banks are covered in case a bank cannot repay their loan. Read more https://t.co/FK3aufc95y

What does this mean? Bonds that fulfill certain sustainability performance targets will become eligible as collateral for Eurosystem credit operations. If they comply with all other eligibility criteria, they can also be included in asset purchase programmes.

We support innovation in the area of sustainable finance! The ECB has decided to accept sustainability-linked bonds as collateral for Eurosystem credit operations as of 1 January 2021. Full press release https://t.co/1DvTAT9BiZ
Occasional paper: Stablecoins - Implications for monetary policy, financial stability, market infrastructure and payments, and banking supervision in the euro area https://t.co/ypkX85wIvJ

The coronavirus pandemic has triggered an unprecedented spike in uncertainty in the euro area. How have measures of uncertainty evolved over the past few months and what are their effects on economic activity? Read more in our latest #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/al7Q2X6d4Y https://t.co/ltkIPmCF6H

The coronavirus crisis has triggered unprecedented levels of household savings. People spent about 10% less during the lockdowns and remain cautious about their future spending. Find out more in our latest #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/w3MWu6xIwZ https://t.co/Q71jQFseK9
You can follow the meeting of the Franco-German Parliamentary Assembly in French here https://t.co/oehl3T0yoC

Lagarde: We must now carry this positive momentum forwards. It is time for Europe to move beyond the initial priority of containing the immediate impact of the crisis and shape a common vision for its future.
Read the full remarks https://t.co/QmejDTMP5U 4/4
Lagarde: We now have an aggregate policy mix in which fiscal and monetary policy reinforce each other in supporting the recovery, and thus underpin medium-term price stability 3/4

Lagarde: Our measures have been complemented by forceful fiscal responses at both national and European levels. This has been a critically important factor in alleviating the impact of the pandemic on the labour market and on banks’ lending 2/4

Six months after we introduced our measures, our policy package has stabilised markets, protected the supply of credit and supported the recovery, says President Christine Lagarde in an address to the Franco-German Parliamentary Assembly 1/4
Watch live: President Christine Lagarde addresses an online meeting of the Franco-German Parliamentary Assembly https://t.co/ZLCHh2Tlyw https://t.co/zvXn8OqWxA
ECB proposes to reduce reporting burden for banks and increase data quality https://t.co/4NCIZsZjK2
Working paper: Banking euro area stress test model https://t.co/fLDWoEILhB
What would you like to ask ECB Chief Economist Philip R. Lane? Post your question using #AskECB and follow his answers live on Thursday, 24 September. https://t.co/rCeOKjnDTm
Find out more about China’s path to normalisation and see how other economies around the world could benefit from it in the #EconomicBulletin 4/4 https://t.co/1pdmzjEc9p

Services suffered due to the ongoing mandatory social distancing rules that affected activities like tourism, travel, cultural and sporting events, and retail. China also saw a drop in domestic demand, which usually contributes more than 50% of its GDP growth 3/4

The China economic activity indicator rose from a low of around 20% of normal levels in February to 90% in just three months. The manufacturing sector led the recovery, while services lagged behind 2/4 https://t.co/qvq8SzIuM8

The Chinese economy has rebounded to levels close to those preceding the #coronavirus pandemic in just three months, following the sharp decline in economic activity resulting from the lockdown earlier this year. Read in full #EconomicBulletin https://t.co/1pdmzjEc9p 1/4 https://t.co/CcP3S7RtO6

de Guindos: en esta crisis el paraguas de las Instituciones Europeas ha sido fundamental para los países más vulnerables, España incluida. Sus actuaciones han limitado el impacto de una crisis tremenda y estan detrás de la senda de la recuperación https://t.co/uFvpydJfvk 2/2

(THREAD) No actuamos en función del tipo de cambio, dice el vicepresidente del BCE, Luis de Guindos, en una entrevista con @larazon_es. Pero observamos un rango de variables económicas, el tipo de cambio incluido, que afecta a las expectativas de inflación a medio plazo 1/2 https://t.co/7Rp24DJDdy

de Guindos: in the current crisis, the protective umbrella of the European institutions has been crucial, especially for the most vulnerable countries. Their actions have limited the impact and are driving the recovery https://t.co/ntcQ2vC2zE 2/2

(THREAD) We do not target the exchange rate, says ECB Vice-President Luis de Guindos in an interview with @larazon_es. However, we monitor a range of economic variables, including the exchange rate because it affects medium-term inflation expectations 1/2 https://t.co/GR4LOHyeyA

The coronavirus crisis has reinforced pre-existing inequalities between and within euro area countries, says Executive Board member @Isabel_Schnabel. Monetary policy is doing its part, but targeted fiscal measures are needed to limit and reduce divergences https://t.co/THjC03Rnep https://t.co/d7RPRSK90v
Working paper: Forecasting the Covid-19 recession and recovery -  Lessons from the financial crisis https://t.co/BlmwGvMnbb

The ECB is publishing its final guide explaining how it assesses whether the models banks use to calculate counterparty credit risk comply with requirements. Read the full press release https://t.co/h9c1V1dPKF
Euro area monthly balance of payments (July 2020) https://t.co/aS6rqGDynO
Find out more about Robert and his colleagues’ work on the topic in their latest research paper https://t.co/sXN56CmjBe

While jobs consisting of routine tasks can be taken over by robots, other jobs are created to perform tasks like installing, monitoring and maintaining them, explains economist @RobertMAnderton in #TheECBPodcast with host @MichaelSteen https://t.co/vWv0aVoSdV https://t.co/lKQ4ucjB8i

The ECB Governing Council confirms that exceptional circumstances justify temporarily excluding central bank exposures from leverage ratios. The measure will ease monetary policy implementation https://t.co/sCWqWVg63U

ECB Banking Supervision allows significant banks to temporarily exclude their holdings of banknotes, coins and central bank deposits from leverage ratio calculations until 27 June 2021. This will increase banks’ leverage ratios https://t.co/zhBDPzC4xi https://t.co/DqOow0xSUJ

Hakkarainen: Some mergers and market exits are likely if banks cannot restore their profitability. State-of-the-art technology is key to keeping pace with digital disruption https://t.co/gBXgRbLQ8Q 3/3

Hakkarainen: As digitalisation and fintech transform the market for banking services, banks must pursue ambitious digital transformation plans to keep their business models sustainable and to offer competitive services 2/3

(THREAD) Euro area banks have been able to continue delivering services during the coronavirus crisis thanks to resilient IT systems, says ECB Supervisory Board member Pentti Hakkarainen at the @IIF Digital Interchange. But operational resilience will not be enough 1/3 https://t.co/Q0JskEX4Oo

Interview @Isabel_Schnabel with Agence France-Presse (AFP)
https://t.co/FHU344PKUJ (EN)
https://t.co/BdIsVy23DG (FR)

Watch live from 13:00 CET: Chief Economist Philip R. Lane participates in the Irish Department of Foreign Affairs & Trade’s #GlobalIreland virtual conference, discussing the global economic impact of the coronavirus https://t.co/tWrnHJ6K07 https://t.co/Jsq6aLwWBn

It is necessary to maintain very favourable liquidity conditions and an ample degree of monetary accommodation for an extended period of time, and in any case for as long as necessary. Read the full speech https://t.co/DcbDL9bIum 5/5

The ECB’s Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its policies depending on incoming data, including exchange rate developments, in order to bring inflation in line with its medium-term aim 4/5

The results achieved by our monetary policy measures are remarkable, but they are not totally satisfactory yet. Inflation is expected to stay uncomfortably below our aim and the balance of risks remains on the downside 3/5

European and national policies must continue to play a crucial role in absorbing the shock, supporting the recovery and achieving sustainable growth. For the first time, we are borrowing together to recover from a common shock and invest in our future #NextGenerationEU 2/5

(THREAD) While Europe has responded to a major challenge, it is not out of the woods yet and we need to remain vigilant, says Executive Board member Fabio Panetta at The @Economist_SEUR’s Roundtable with the Government of Greece. Watch the speech https://t.co/z4ZeJta7HR 1/5
@Lagarde @NGFS Thanks to @richimcmahon and @Neclis for spotting that the correct handle for the Network for Greening the Financial System is of course @NGFS_. Apologies for the confusion!

Fighting climate change with the Network for Greening the Financial System is just one of the issues we are looking at as part of the #ECBstrategyreview. Come and tell us what else you think we can do via the #ECBListens Portal https://t.co/6pjUf5g0Mu https://t.co/REfQ7bv2RQ
Speech Christine Lagarde: Remarks at the Annual Meeting of the Council of Governors of the Arab Central Banks and Monetary Authorities https://t.co/bA1r7WVQlD
ECB lists Bulgarian and Croatian banks it will directly supervise as of October 2020 https://t.co/ltUv9atUJ0

Following the significance assessment of Bulgarian and Croatian banks, the ECB will start directly supervising five banks in Bulgaria and eight banks in Croatia in October. Read full press release https://t.co/SHuNpK55ap https://t.co/JpEkIsZ1Ql

Over the coming months, a richer information set will become available that will help to inform the calibration of monetary policy. The Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate. Read the blog post https://t.co/oULpQH0K2F 5/5

Our updated scenario analysis highlights that the range of possible outcomes remains extremely wide, with a much faster and complete recovery in the mild scenario but a more protracted adjustment path under the severe scenario 4/5 https://t.co/EqJnnWg24m

Economic activity remains well below pre-pandemic levels. Although consumer spending has increased over the summer following a spectacular increase in the savings rate during the first half of the year, many households are likely to continue to be cautious 3/5 https://t.co/5t7Si3pCmM

Following the record decline in output of 11.8 percent in the second quarter, the incoming data indicate a strong rebound in euro area economic activity during the third quarter. Domestic demand is bouncing back significantly and business investment is also recovering 2/5

(THREAD) While the monetary policy decisions we took in March and June are providing crucial support for the economic recovery, there is no room for complacency, writes Chief Economist Philip R. Lane in #TheECBBlog https://t.co/oULpQH0K2F 1/5 https://t.co/Ce7pytoTbz
Working paper: The great lockdown - Pandemic response policies and bank lending conditions https://t.co/g9jNtbAgPg
Working paper: Macroeconomic risks across the globe due to the Spanish Flu https://t.co/NAhWiuC590

Speech Yves Mersch: Supervisory action in times of crisis and the limits of the ECB’s prudential mandate https://t.co/f8N1IDkMGB
Payments statistics 2019 https://t.co/mGWl3trCsM
Executive Board member Philip R. Lane blog post: The outlook for the euro area https://t.co/oULpQH0K2F

In today’s press conference, President @Lagarde explained how our Strategy Review will shortly resume after it was paused at the height of the pandemic crisis. You can have your say via the #ECBListens portal https://t.co/AWKNKN67pu https://t.co/4KSPXc1YJh

How we pay and the systems that support our payments must continue to modernise along with European consumers’ preferences. It is our duty to ensure that people have access to riskless and state-of-the-art payment services that reflect our changing economy 2/3

(THREAD) Innovation in payments enables easier and faster interactions in the digital age, said ECB President @Lagarde at the @Bundesbank's conference on banking and payments in the digital world. But it also comes in new forms that raise important questions 1/3 https://t.co/BqJzzjhE07
Coming up: ECB President @Lagarde speaks tonight at the @Bundesbank’s conference on banking and payments in the digital world. Watch live from 19:00 CET https://t.co/CLhvtnheYz

Our research shows that countries with stronger digital job growth tend to be the ones that have stronger total employment growth and the lowest unemployment rates, says economist Valerie Jarvis in #TheECBPodcast. Tune in with host @MichaelSteen https://t.co/vWv0aV7gPl https://t.co/XwjIUdf6YO

The reforms should be pursued jointly and immediately. They could speed up the European recovery and increase growth potential, which would strengthen public finances. They would also support the transition to a low-carbon and digital economy https://t.co/fBo4VWdEL9 3/3

Priority should be given to reforms in five mutually reinforcing areas: regulation and legal frameworks, supervision and oversight, fiscal policy and public debt markets, financial market development, and securitisation 2/3

(THREAD) The coronavirus crisis makes progress on capital markets union even more important, write ECB Vice-President Luis de Guindos and Executive Board members Fabio Panetta and @Isabel_Schnabel in a joint blog post 1/3 https://t.co/G5ThyyA6vF
Find out more in the paper on digitalisation and its impact on the euro area economy, co-authored by our podcast guests https://t.co/d76Rm8mPy1
